item.title: How to REST the Have I Been Pwned (HIBP) API
item.author: Author
item.description: Perform REST API requests to the HIBP API to verify if your email or password have been involved in a data breach.

item.title: Understanding and Improving Your Cybersecurity Posture in 2023: The Importance of strong Passwords, 2FA and Awareness of Phishing Scams
item.author: Author
item.description: Cybersecurity is the practice of protecting internet-connected systems, including hardware, software, and data, from attack, damage, or unauthorized access. One aspect of cybersecurity is protecting personal information, such as passwords, account data but also your privacy. In this article, we revisit the basics in cyber security, as there are daily new attacks and ways hackers try to get personal data.

item.title: Fresh Development Setup within 10 Minutes using Winget
item.author: Author
item.description:
Sometimes you have to setup your Laptop/Notebook fresh and also prepare your developer environment and tools you need. I noticed this again today when I rebooted my machine and spent almost 2 hours installing the tools I need to work.

I have put together a list of commands you can use to prepare your environment using Windows Package Manager (WinGet) for you which gives you a kick start at the next reset and you can continue working directly after 10 minutes.

item.title: How to install and update Azure PowerShell 7
item.author: Author
item.description: Let’s keep it easy with these one-liner’s you can use for Windows as well as Linux.

item.title: Set primary IP address order with multiple IP addresses on a NIC
item.author: Author
item.description: If you’re running a webserver it may be you have to run different services on the same port and need to use multiple IP addresses on the same network interface. This can happen for SMTP or Exchange Servers using several connectors.

item.title: Get-LogonHistory: Who was logged on to my server?
item.author: Author
item.description: Every System Administrator comes into a situation where you want to see who and how many users were logged on to your servers either via Remote Desktop or via script.

item.title: Get-PSVersions: Retrieve Powershell version remotely
item.author: Author
item.description: Okay at the end it’s a simple $PSVersion wrapped in an Invoke-Command but hey these simple things are needful in case you need to run it against of 100s of servers and not just locally. With the help of Invoke-Command via WinRM and $PSVersionTable.psversion wrapped in a foreach you can retrieve PowerShell version of your remote computers indifferent if you need to use credentials to run it against a different domain than you currently reside. Just use the below function Get-PSVersions, simple but good.

item.title: Resolve-DnsNames: Resolve DNS or IP for multiple Computers
item.author: Author
item.description:
Respective Microsoft’s Technet article regarding Resolve-DnsName I have created a function with the ability to run it against more than only one computer. Resolve-DnsNames performs a DNS name query resolution for the specified name.

item.title: Get-DellTags: Get Dell Tags and Express Service Code remotely
item.author: Author
item.description: Get DELL Tag and Express Service Code remotely for more than one computer.

item.title: Get-ScsiDisks: Combine Physicaldisk and Logicaldisk Objects
item.author: Author
item.description:
Hi there, following function Get-ScsiDisks retrieves disk details for VMWare Guests or any computer with corresponding SCSI disk details like SCSI ID and SCSI Bus. The function concatenates objects consisting of Win32_DiskDrive, Win32_LogicalDisk and Win32_DiskDriveToDiskPartition using WMI. For WinRM you can use Invoke-Command and inject the script.
